IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO STRENGTHEN INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WHILE ADVANCING COMMUNITY SYSTEMS OF CARE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO STRENGTHEN INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WHILE ADVANCING COMMUNITY SYSTEMS OF CARE.
IRS990.Description: Dawn Project - Indiana Department of Child Services: The Indiana Department of Child Services has contracted with Choices to deliver cross-system care coordination to up to 300 youth in Marion County, Indiana. The services are for youth with severe emotional disturbances and behavioral challenges that are involved in multiple care systems and are involved with DCS and/or juvenile probation. Cross-system care coordination is designed to facilitate child and family teams comprised of youth, families, their natural support persons, local systems, agencies and community members. The services provided are comprehensive and include cross-system coordination, case management, safety and crisis planning, comprehensive strength-based discovery and assessment, activities of daily living training, and assistance to the DCS family case manager in the facilitation of the child and family team process.

Activity2.Description: Hamilton Choices: Multi County System Agencies (MCSA) has contracted with Hamilton Choices to administer care coordination services, designed to ensure youth receive the services they need to successfully achieve treatment goals. Specific services include: Individualized wraparound planning, individual assessment, ongoing service coordination, proactive disenrollments, provider management, information systems, outcome monitoring and reporting, and system-wide coordination and improvement.

Activity3.Description: Maryland Choices: The care coordinator works with each family and their child to develop and maintain a plan of care, including a crisis stabilization plan if a potential or safety concern exists, and being available to the family regardless of time or day of the week. The care coordinator has an ongoing and thorough awareness of the community resources that are being delivered to the family. The care coordinator continues to help the family identify other community and individual supports that can be used by the family to achieve their care plan.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION USED CORYDON GROUP TO EXPAND CONTACTS IN THE STATE OF INDIANA.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THERE IS NO FIN 48 DISCLOSURE IN THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE FOLLOWING STATEMENT REGARDING INCOME TAXES IS IN THE NOTES OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS: The Organization files tax returns in the U.S. federal jurisdiction. With a few exceptions, the Organization is no longer subject to U.S. federal examinations by tax authorities for years before 2007.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: PROCESS FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: CHOICES SUPPORTS ITS RELATED ORGANIZATION, FAMILIES REACHING FOR RAINBOWS. ALL BUSINESS FUNCTIONS FOR fAMILIES IS PERFORMED BY CHOICES AND THEIR FINANCIAL ACTIVITY IS INCLUDED IN THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR CHOICES.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EXPENSES YES/BACK TO HOME 1,320,349 WASHINGTON D.C. 3,237,614 OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 1,317,997 TOTAL 5,875,960 PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES LISTED IN PART III DO NOT INCLUDE GENERAL ADMINISTRATIVE AND OTHER MANAGERIAL EXPENSES INVOLVED IN OPERATING THE ORGANIZATION.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, QUESTION 6, 7A, & 7B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WE HAVE ONE CLASS OF MEMBERSHIP. MEMBERS MUST BE ORGANIZATIONS OR ENTITIES THAT DIRECTLY OR THROUGH AN AFFILIATE (I) IS REGULARLY ENGAGED IN THE BUSINESS OR ACTIVITY OF PROVIDING BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES; (II) HAS AN ORGANIZED AND OPERATING CLINICAL MANAGEMENT SYSTEM OR A PLAN OR ABILITY TO IMPLEMENT SUCH A SYSTEM IN THE FUTURE; (III) HAS A SUFFICIENT NUMBER OF HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS;, STAFF AND OTHER PERSONNEL TO PROVIDE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES; (IV) HAS AN ORGANIZED AND OPERATING FINANCIAL SYSTEM OR METHODOLOGY THAT ALLOWS THE ACCEPTANCE AND PROCESSING OF FEE-FOR-SERVICE AND CAPITATED PAYMENTS; AND (V) IS EITHER AN INDIANA COUNTY HOSPITAL OR INDIANA NONPROFIT CORPORATION WHICH IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL TAXATION BECAUSE IT IS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE FOUR MENTAL HEALTH CENTERS THAT ORGANIZED CHOICES AND ARE MEMBERS AS DESCRIBED IN THIS PARAGRAPH CAN EACH ELECT A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. ANY DECISIONS OF THE GOVERNING BODY ARE SUBJECT TO APPROVAL BY BOTH THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND A MAJORITY OF THE FOUR MENTAL HEALTH CENTER MEMBERS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, QUESTION 11A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CFO AND CORPORATE CONTROLLER WILL DO A DETAIL REVIEW OF THE FORM 990 BEFORE PRESENTING IT TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE WILL REVIEW THE 990, PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM, AND MAKE A RECOMMENDATION TO THE BOARD TO ACCEPT THE 990 AS PRESENTED.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ANNUALLY INDIVIDUALS IN MANAGEMENT OR LEADERSHIP POSITIONS SIGN A STATEMENT THAT THEY DO NOT HAVE A CONFLICT AND THEY KNOW OF NO EMPLOYEES UNDER THEIR SUPERVISION WHO ARE IN CONFLICT WITH THE POLICY. THE CFO AND THE ORGANIZATION'S ACCOUNTING FIRM REVIEW THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS. IF A CONFLICT IS FOUND IT IS BROUGHT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE BOARD AND THAT BOARD MEMBER ABSTAINS FROM VOTING ON THAT ISSUE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CEO AND KEY EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION REVIEW
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, QUESTION 15A & 15B
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEETS, REVIEWS, DISCUSSES AND APPROVES THE CEO'S SALARY AND BENEFIT PLAN. THE LAST SALARY REVIEW WAS CONDUCTED FOR THE YEAR ENDING 6/30/2010 USING COMPARATIVE DATA. THE CFO'S COMPENSATION IS APPROVED BY THE CEO USING COMPARATIVE DATA.
GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

CHOICES CARE COORDINATORS USE A NON-PROFIT MENTORING SERVICE PROVIDER TO SUPPLEMENT SERVICES IN THEIR CASES. ALL TRANSACTIONS ARE CONDUCTED AT ARMS LENGTH AND MUST BE AUTHORIZED BY A CARE COORDINATOR BASED ON NEED. NO MEMBERS OF CHOICES' UPPER MANAGEMENT ARE INVOLVED IN THE DECISION TO USE THIS MENTORING SERVICE PROVIDER.
